thread.title: NFL Experience at Houston's convention center drew 175,000 visitors
thread.title_full: NFL Experience at Houston's convention center drew 175,000 visitors

author: Chronicle Staff
title: NFL Experience at Houston's convention center drew 175,000 visitors
text:
Close Image 1 of 3 Eric Jew runs through a tunnel wearing a J.J. Watt, of the Houston Texans, jersey during Super Bowl LI activities at the NFL Experience in the George R. Brown Convention Center on Saturday, Jan. 28, 2017, in Houston. ( Brett Coomer / Houston Chronicle ) less Eric Jew runs through a tunnel wearing a J.J. Brown Convention Center.﻿ Photo: Brett Coomer, Staff Image 3 of 3 Melissa Hormoz, 10, puts on a paper football helmet with her classmates at Cooper Elementary as they check out the NFL Experience as part of the NFL Play 60 Kids' Day on Wednesday, Feb. 1, 2017, in Houston. ( Elizabeth Conley / Houston Chronicle ) less Melissa Hormoz, 10, puts on a paper football helmet with her classmates at Cooper Elementary as they check out the NFL Experience as part of the NFL Play 60 Kids' Day on Wednesday, Feb. 1, 2017, in Houston. ( ... more Photo: Elizabeth Conley, Staff NFL Experience at Houston's convention center drew 175,000 visitors 1 / 3 Back to Gallery 
More than 175,000 fans visited the NFL Experience during its seven days in Houston, organizers said Sunday. 
The 24th installment of the event was held at the George R. Brown Convention Center, across from the "NFL Live" fan festival at Discovery Green. Saturday represented the first single-day sell-out of the football-themed experience. 
The NFL Experience by Genesis opened Jan 28 and closed Sunday; it was also closed two days for private events. 
Organizers noted that the event allowed fans of all ages to "get in the game with numerous interactive activities and games, impressive displays of NFL history and daily opportunities to get up close with some of football's greatest players of the past and present."
